result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon L. Wilson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of the Plea & Sentencing hearing on 02/24/2015
Criminal case settlement

Cases 14CF383 and 14CF387 called at 10:28am[MO]
Defendant Brandon L. Wilson in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1 of case 14CF383; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #14CF387 and  Count #2 of case 14CF383.

Arguments given by Counsel.
Statement given by Mr. Wilson

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:

--to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, including for work and Batterers Intervention Treatment; to commence immediately at the conclusion of conditional jail in Jefferson case 2014CF43
--NO Contact with APRIL BRUSCHNIG, or any of her children except to the extent that contact is approved through juvenile court orders AND approved by probation agent after the expiration of juvenile court orders
--to pay costs of  $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
Felony firearm/ voting prohibition warnings given. 
recess: 11:23am
NOH for def sent to LKA//def is in custody
Status conference on February 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 4, 2015 at 09:20 am.
Scheduling Notice

cases #14CF383 and #14CF387 called at 9:10am. [MK]
Defendant Brandon L. Wilson in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
As to both cases, Mr. Wilson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts these waivers and binds him over for Trial in both cases.

Arraignment held in both cases:
--service of Informations admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
recess 9:18am.


NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 2/4/15 at 9:20am  (2) Status Conference on 2/24/15 at 10:00am.
Defendants demand
Note from JA ref RUMS
Def. NOH for the 1/20/15 Preliminary hearing for cases 14CF383 & 14CF387; Return to Sender; Not deliverable as addressed; Unable to Forward
Preliminary hearing on January 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon L. Wilson
Current: 700 E Main Street #218, Watertown, WI 53094 United States  (Effective: 12-18-2014)
Prior: 700 E Main Street, Watertown, WI 53094 United States
Court quashes warrant

Cases 14CF43, 14CF383 & 14CF387 called at 10:17 am
Defendant Brandon L. Wilson in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews warrants were issued based on the defendant's non-appearance at 8:00 am.
Court and ADA Teuber review phone call from DA's Office regarding victim rights compliance.
ADA Teuber advises the Court that the State has victim rights compliance.

ADA Teuber presents argument in support of the State's Motion to Revoke Bond.
Attorney De La Rosa presents argument against State's Motion to Revoke Bond.

Court vacates it's order for Pre-Sentence Investigation.
Court presents basis and revokes the defendant's bond, and orders the defendant be held in custody without bond.

Attorney De La Rosa advises the defense would like a January date for sentencing.
ADA Teuber advises that would also be her request.

Court will hold sentencing on 1/6/15 at 3:00 pm.
Court will refer 14CF383 & 14CF387 to Branch 3 for further scheduling.
Court quashes warrants.

Attorney De La Rosa advises that the defendant would like for him to withdraw so another attorney can do the sentencing earlier.
Corut denies the request.

recess: 10:40 am
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Sentencing Hearing: 1/6/15 at 3:00 pm (14CF43)

Court refers 14CF383 & 14CF387 to Br. 3 for further scheduling.

Cases 14CF43, 14CF383 & 14CF387 called together at 8:05 am [Clerk SH]
Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa: Ran into Mr. Wilson last week here at the courthouse, spoke quickly. Have not had contact with him since last week. Unsure why Mr. Wilson does not appear, unsure if he's had contact with SPD Office.
Court orders issuance of bench warrant - Body Only on all cases
ADA Teuber informs the Court of officer reports & actions she has requested of JCHSD
Upon questioning of Atty De La Rosa, the Court indicates warrants are for falilure to appear
Court takes no action on State's motion to revoke bond, but informs parties that It will address when Mr. Wilson is in-custody
Recess: 8:10 am
Note from JA-whereabouts unknown ref RUMS
Attorney De La Rosa
Def. NOH on cases 14CF383/14CF387 for the 12/18/14 STC; Moved Left No Address; Unable to Forward; Return to Sender
CLERKS NOTE: Defendant called at 4:03pm today with his new address. He was advised to contact his attorney and have the change of address done in writing ASAP for the Court.
Status conference on December 18, 2014 at 08:00 am.

**Minutes from 14CF43**
Case 14CF43 called at 11:52 am
Defendant Brandon L. Wilson in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Susan Happ and ADA Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #
 1.

Court orders a long form PSI be completed.
ADA Teuber informs the Court that she believes that a long form is not needed.
Court will order a short form PSI, the Court will keep the file and try to get sentencing in before the end of the year or early january.

Court will set 14CF383 & 14CF387 call as status probable change of plea and sentencing along with this file.
Defendant to provide current address by 4:00 pm on 11/14/14.

recess: 12:07 pm
NEXT: (Notice to be mailed)
Sentencing Hearing: 12/18/14 at 8:00 am
Status: for 14CF383 & 14CF387 12/18/14 at 8:00 am

cases #14CF43, #14CF383, and #14CF387 called at 11:23am. [MK]
Defendant Brandon L. Wilson in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Initial Appearance conducted in Cases #14CF383 and #14CF387: 
--Service of the Complaints admitted; reading waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
--Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties
--The Court requires a $2,500 signature bond (applies to both Cases #14CF383 and #14CF387), with condition:  to comply with all bond conditions in Case #14CF43.

Mr. Wilson indicates that his current address is on Madison Street in Watertown, WI.  The Court requires Mr. Wilson to provide the Court's Judicial Assistant [direct telephone number was provided] with the specific street address by this afternoon. 
recess 11:28am. [The Court proceeds with the Final Status/Scheduling Conference in Case #14CF43 only]. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on November 26th  at 10:00am (2) schedule both cases for Preliminary Hearings after the Pretrial date
